title: jQuery
text: The Rotorweb theme adds jQuery support. To avoid cross-site loading - which would require user consent due to the European GDPR - a ‘frozen’ version of jQuery is shipped with the Rotorweb extension. Currently jQuery 3.6.0 is included (see github).

title: Webheader
text:
Retoweb adds additional functionality to control the header of the website (thus, webheader). Two different types are available: image or carousel. When set, this will overrule quartos title blocks.
The index page of the template shows a series of variations for type: carousel. The webheader can be defined in the yml header of the individual .qmd.






Info



Note that the images must be located in header-images/ (or any other folder defined as resources in _quarto.yml).


Example 1: A simple rotating header with two images without additional image options specified. The interval time for auto rotation is set to 2 seconds.
webheader:
    type: carousel
    options:
        interval: 2000
    images:
        - image: header-images/unsplash-1.jpg
        - image: header-images/unsplash-2.jpg
Example 2: Rotating carousel-type header with two images, whereof the first makes use of all available image options. The second solely includes an alternative text which is included in the HTML but does not change the appearance.
webheader:
    type: carousel
    options:
        interval: 2000
    images:
        - image: header-images/unsplash-1.jpg
          title: "Image number one."
          description: "Full header with icon, title, description, and background color."
          alt: Page header showing the websites logo on top of an artistic blueish background.
          bg: "rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2)"
          icon: assets/logo-rotorweb-white.svg

        - image: header-images/unsplash-2.jpg
          alt: Page header image for design purposes.
Example 3: Static header image. As only one image is provided, the page will always show the image as defined.
webheader:
    type: image
    images:
        - image: header-images/unsplash-1.jpg
Example 4: Static but random header image. Each time the page is loaded one (randomly selected) image among the ones defined will be displayed. The [about][about.qmd] page shows how this looks like.
webheader:
    type: image
    images:
        - image: header-images/unsplash-1.jpg
        - image: header-images/unsplash-2.jpg
        - image: header-images/unsplash-3.jpg
        - image: header-images/unsplash-4.jpg


The two types available are:







Type
Description




carousel
series of rotating images. Allows for additional styling (see [below])


image
single or random image (static)






Defined under options. For now, only the interval (for automated carousel rotation) can be defined.







Option
Description




interval
Positive integer, rotation-interval in milliseconds. Defaults to 4000 if not specified.






The following options are available to define an image. All besides image are optional and affect the way the image(s) are displayed.







Option
Description




image
Name/path of the header image. If not specified it will simply be ignored.


title
Title to be displayed.


description
Description to be displayed.


alt
Alternative information added to the image.


bg
Background color, any valid css definition (e.g., red, #fff, rgba(100, 100, 100, 0.3)).


icon
Name/path of an icon/image to be displayed on top of the header image.









Features for type: image



Does not yet provide the optional arguments like title, description, alt, bg, or icon but will be added (TODO(R)).

title: Rotorweb Template & Demo
text:
Features provided

jQuery: Adds additional jQuery support.
Webheader: Allows to add images, random images, and sequences of auto-rotating images to the header of the page.
Block carousel: Allows to add in-line image carousels.

title: Rotorweb Template & Demo
text:
Getting started
To get started we need to clone the template repository as well as cloning the quarto extension which contains the Rotorweb extension.
git clone https://github.com/retostauffer/rotorweb-template.git mywebsite
cd mywebsite
git submodule add https://github.com/retostauffer/rotorweb-ext.git _extensions/rotorweb
When cloned, the extension can be installed and the page rendered.
quarto install extension .
quarto render
The website will be rendered into docs/.

title: About
text:
Why Rotorweb?
The theme name Rotorweb was chosen as it resembles many different aspects of why this theme has been created and who created it.
One of the main goal was to develop a Quarto theme which allows us to replace existing websites built with the jekyll. One of the features missing were the ‘rotating header images’, one of the main reasons for the name Rotorweb.
In addition, R is the first letter of the first name of the authors and one of his preferred programming languages: R.
Quarto helps to ‘lift’ and raise dynamic documents to the next level using quarto to create websites, presentations, exercises and documents using R, Python and Julia.
